meanings.definition: The belief that different human races have separate origins.
meanings.sent1: Some people in the past believed in polygenesis, thinking that each race came from a different place.
meanings.sent2: Polygenesis was a controversial idea in the study of human races.
meanings.sent3: The idea of polygenesis seemed strange to many, as it suggested that humans did not all come from the same source.
meanings.sent4: Polygenesis can be compared to a tree with many branches, each representing a different race.
meanings.sent5: The concept of polygenesis can be difficult to grasp, but it highlights the diversity of human origins.

meanings.definition: The theory that a single species can have multiple distinct evolutionary origins.
meanings.sent1: Scientists debated the theory of polygenesis, discussing whether one species could have multiple beginnings.
meanings.sent2: Polygenesis challenges the traditional view of evolution as a linear process.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if animals believed in polygenesis, thinking they all evolved from different starting points!
meanings.sent4: The idea of polygenesis is like a puzzle with pieces from different sets coming together to form a whole.
meanings.sent5: Polygenesis paints a picture of a species branching out in various directions, each path leading to a unique outcome.
